subject: Loading test data from XML
msgSnippet: ... There s not much that JUnit will do /for/ you here. Try writing the first test: parse the XML, then use the data in your test. In the worst case, your test
messageBody:
sudhakar_rsr1 wrote:

> I am just a beginner for JUNIT. Can any body send the examples or
> related URL's to test a class using XML as INPUT file rather using
> an excel file.

There's not much that JUnit will do /for/ you here. Try writing the
first test: parse the XML, then use the data in your test. In the worst
case, your test has a loop that runs the same code for each "row" of
data in your XML document. Something like this pseudocode:

test:
testData = parseXml();
foreach (row in testData)
doTest(row)

doTest(row):
// Your actual test code, using the data in "row"

If this good enough for you, then great; and if there's anything you
don't like about it, come back and let us know. We can decide what to do
next.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
